Sort OSM files

Source: R/sort.R
osm_sort.Rd

This is a wrapper for osmium sort. Combines and sorts the content of one or more OSM files. Objects are ordered by type (node, way, relation), by ID (negative IDs first, then positive, sorted by absolute value), and by version. Duplicate objects are preserved. Works with data, history, and change files.

Usage

osm_sort(
  input_paths,
  output_path,
  strategy = c("simple", "multipass"),
  input_format = NULL,
  output_format = NULL,
  fsync = FALSE,
  generator = NULL,
  overwrite = FALSE,
  output_header = NULL,
  echo_cmd = FALSE,
  echo = TRUE,
  spinner = TRUE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  progress = FALSE
)

Arguments

input_paths

Character vector of paths to one or more existing OSM files.

output_path

String. Path to the file where the sorted output will be written. The format is inferred from the extension unless output_format is set.

strategy

Character(1). Sorting strategy, either "simple" (default, single-pass in-memory) or "multipass" (three passes, lower memory).

input_format

Optional string. Force the input format (e.g. "osm", "pbf", "osc"). If NULL, autodetect.

output_format

Optional string. Force the output format (e.g. "osm", "pbf", "osc"). If NULL, autodetect.

fsync

Logical(1). If TRUE, call fsync after writing the output file to flush buffers. Defaults to FALSE.

generator

Optional string. Name/version to write into the generator header. Default is "osmium/<version>".

overwrite

Logical(1). If TRUE, allow overwriting an existing output_path. Defaults to FALSE.

output_header

Named character vector of additional header options. Each name is the header key, each value is the header value. If a value is "", writes OPTION!. Defaults to NULL.

echo_cmd

A logical. Whether to print the Osmium command generated by the function call to the screen. Defaults to FALSE.

echo

A logical. Whether to print the standard output and error generated by the Osmium call to the screen. Defaults to TRUE.

spinner

A logical. Whether to show a reassuring spinner while the Osmium call is being executed. Defaults to TRUE.

verbose

A logical. Whether to display detailed information on the running command. Defaults to FALSE.

progress

A logical. Whether to display a progress bar while running the command. Defaults to FALSE.

Value

Invisibly returns the normalized path to output_path.

Examples

# sort a single PBF file
pbf <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "rosmium")
out <- tempfile(fileext = ".osm.pbf")
osm_sort(pbf, out, overwrite = TRUE)
